idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

descript.abstract: United States States (Generalized) is a polygon theme representing the 50 states and the District of Columbia of the United States. Attribute information includes a variety of variables from the 2000 U.S. Census. This dataset is a part of the 2010 ESRI Data & Maps collection
descript.purpose: United States States (Generalized) provides demographic information and generalized state boundaries to improve draw performance and be used effectively at a national level.
descript.supplinf:
Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:3,000,000.
This dataset comes with an ESRI layer file symbolizing the features.

citeinfo.origin: Economic and Social Research Institute (Reston, Va.)
citeinfo.title: United States States (Generalized)

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States- Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/company/locations.html.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

enttyp.enttypd: A type of governmental unit that is the primary legal subdivision of the United States. The U.S. Census Bureau treats the District of Columbia as the equivalent of a state for data presentation purposes.

attr.attrdef: The subregion of the United States in which a state is located. The U.S. subregions are as defined by the U.S. Census Bureau, except in this data set New England is classified as a subregion instead of a region.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI software.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States, contact the ESRI Telebusiness staff at 800-447-9778 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local ESRI Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/company/locations.html.

citeinfo.title: Summary File 1 (SF1)
citeinfo.othercit: The Summary File 1 (SF1) data is based on the 2000 Census of Population.

citeinfo.title: ESRI Data - Updated Demographics, 2010
citeinfo.othercit: Currently provides the POP2010 attribute. In the past has provided the POP2009, POP2008, POP2007, POP2005, POP2004, POP2003, and POP2001 attributes.

citeinfo.title: 1997 Census of Agriculture; 2007 Census of Agriculture
citeinfo.origin: U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS)

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS)

citeinfo.othercit: The farm attributes come from data published by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS) based on the 2007 Census of Agriculture. In the past the attributes came from the 1997 Census of Agriculture.

procstep.procdesc:
The following steps were performed by ESRI for Data & Maps 2002: Replaced demographic and agricultural attributes with the latest from 2000 Census SF1, ESRI Data, and 1997 Census of Agriculture. Recreated ArcView GIS legend file (.avl) and ArcGIS layer file (.lyr). Copied projection file (.prj).
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted and generalized the features from ArcUSA 1:25M. Added demographic attributes from Summary Tape File-1A (STF-1A) data published by the U.S. Census Bureau based on the 1990 Census of Population. Added farm attributes from data published by the U.S. Census Bureau based on the 1987 Census of Agriculture. Added Pop2000 attribute from ESRI. Converted to North American Datum of 1983 (NAD83) by splitting the United States into-if present: Alaska, Hawaii, Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands-and the 48 contiguous states (including District of Columbia); converting each to NAD83; then merging them together. Recalculated any attributes based on area. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr). Created ArcView GIS legend file (.avl). Created projection file (.prj). Ran ArcView GIS Avenue™ request ExportClean, and created spatial indices.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Copied the Molokai coastline from U.S. Counties (Generalized). Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Replaced POP2001 with POP2003 from ESRI. Converted the data set to SDC. Created the projection file (.prj) and spatial indices.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Renamed attribute AREA to SQMI, moved it to the end of the attributes, and rounded its values to the nearest whole number. Replaced attribute POP2003 with POP2004. Added attribute POP04_SQMI and calculated its values.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Replaced attribute POP2004 with POP2005 and attribute POP04_SQMI with POP05_SQMI. Expanded the values for attribute SUB_REGION. Changed POP00_SQMI to display its tenths place. Calculated new values for attributes POP00_SQMI, POP05_SQMI, and SQMI. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Replaced attribute POP2005 with POP2007 and attribute POP05_SQMI with POP07_SQMI. Calculated new values for POP07_SQMI. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Replaced attribute POP2007 with POP2008 and attribute POP07_SQMI with POP08_SQMI. Calculated new values for POP08_SQMI. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Replaced attribute POP2008 with POP2009 and attribute POP08_SQMI with POP09_SQMI. Calculated new values for POP09_SQMI. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Copied 2009 Data Update U.S. States (Generalized) and renamed it. Removed all fields but STATE_NAME. Attached and formatted the fields from Edition 10 U.S. States. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was extracted from the ArcUSA 1:25M database, and then generalized. Generalizing reduces positional accuracy and the tolerance was not recorded so the positional accuracy exceeds that of the ArcUSA data set. The positional accuracy of the ArcUSA 1:25M data set is 1792 meters which is based on generalizing-to a tolerance of 500 meters-the 1:2,000,000-scale USGS Digital Line Graph (DLG) source data.

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either tools in ArcGIS or ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2). The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
